data.title: Elizabeth I in Cinema
data.meta_description: Queen Elizabeth I has intrigued audiences since she was born in 1533. Today her legend lives on as writers and historians and filmmakers piece together her legacy. In this article historian, author and broadcaster Kate Williams looks at the different portrayals of Elizabeth I on screen to separate fact from fiction.
data.text:
ELIZABETH I AND ROBERT DUDLEY

Queen Elizabeth I and Robert Dudley were certainly emotionally dependent on each other throughout their lives, but were they ever really lovers?

WHY WAS ELIZABETH I SO IMPORTANT?

Best-selling author and historian Dr Tracy Borman explains what the accession of Elizabeth I in November 1558 meant for women in power.
